content:
There are many up and coming natural wines that are gaining popularity among wine enthusiasts. Here are a few examples of natural wines that people might not know about yet:

1. Pétillant-Naturel (Pét-Nat) Wines: These are sparkling wines that are bottled before primary fermentation is complete, resulting in a lightly carbonated and slightly cloudy wine. They are often made with non-traditional grape varieties and can have a range of flavors, from fruity and floral to yeasty and funky. Some notable examples include:
* Michael Cruse, Monkey Jacket, Valdiguié, North Coast, California, USA
* La Grange Tiphaine, Nouveau-Nez, Chenin Blanc, Loire Valley, France
* Christophe Pacalet, Pétillant Naturel, Gamay, Beaujolais, France
2. Wines from Greece: Greece has a long history of winemaking, but its natural wine scene is relatively new and still emerging. Some exciting natural wines from Greece include:
* Lyrarakis, Plyto, Crete, Greece
* Markovitis, Ancestral Tradition, Limnio, Thessaly, Greece
* Troupis, Fteri Moschofilero, Arcadia, Greece
3. Wines from Hungary: Hungary is another country with a long winemaking tradition that is now embracing natural and biodynamic practices. Some notable natural wines from Hungary include:
* Meinklang, Foam Cuvée, Hárslevelü, Burgenland, Austria (this wine is made with grapes from the Hungarian side of the border)
* Wetzer, Kékfrankos, Sopron, Hungary
* Fekete Béla, Juhfark, Somló, Hungary
4. Natural Wines from South Africa: South Africa's natural wine scene is still relatively small, but it is gaining attention for its unique and expressive wines. Some exciting natural wines from South Africa include:
* Testalonga, El Bandito, Chenin Blanc, Swartland, South Africa
* Jurgen Gouws, Nativo, Cinsault, Stellenbosch, South Africa
* The Blacksmith Wines, The Blood of Jove, Syrah, Swartland, South Africa

These are just a few examples of the many exciting natural wines that are emerging from around the world. As the natural wine movement continues to grow, there will undoubtedly be many more new and interesting wines to discover.
